sections.TOP:
Magnar020184g9dka64t8t63uwnkpqy1zsao3xa3g1v1798842015-03-27T18:32:17ZThe Dragon Demands5014364{{Quote|[The Thenns] follow their "Magnar," who's the kind of a man who can rule these kinds of men. I know what you Southerners are thinking. And no, the Magnar is not a king. More like their god. Though not one you'd care to follow if you don't sleep with your eyes open.|[[Tormund]]|The Nations of the North}} 
'''Magnar''' is a word in the [[Old Tongue]] of the [[First Men]] which translates as "''[[Lordship|Lord]]''" in the [[Common Tongue]]. It is also the title held by the leader of the [[Thenns|Thenn]], a tribe of the [[Free Folk]].
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, "Magnar" is also the name of a noble house established at Kinghouse, in the island of [[Skagos]].
